data.title: Cambodian trade union leader Chhim Sithar, released from prison: “We must keep speaking out and uniting for our rights” - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: In a conversation with Equal Times, Chhim Sithar discusses her commitment to defending workers’ rights in Cambodia, her years of detention, and what her future holds – particularly whether her plans may involve the still unresolved labour conflict at NagaWorld. Phnom Penh, 2019.

data.title: Cambodian maid is arrested and deported by Malaysia for criticizing Cambodia leaders on social media - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: A Cambodian woman who worked as a maid in Malaysia has been deported to her homeland for comments she posted on social media.

data.title: UN chief implicitly criticizes Cambodia’s upcoming elections after top opposition party ban - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres implicitly criticized Cambodia’s upcoming elections Wednesday for failing to be inclusive, after the top opposition party was not allowed to register.

data.title: Foreign Ministry says Anwar unaware of Cambodian opposition figure's entry - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: The Foreign Ministry confirmed that ex-Cambodian opposition leader Sam Rainsy has left Malaysia Wednesday morning.

data.title: Cambodia’s leader says arrested protesters were trying to overthrow the government - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cambodia’s leader on Thursday condemned international human rights groups for criticizing the arrest of nearly 100 people for protesting against a decades-old regional development agreement with neighboring countries.

data.title: Cambodia preparing strategy to graduate from LDC status by 2029: PM - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cambodia has received the UN Committee for Development Policy's evaluation to pass the three-year review so that it can exit the LDC status.

data.title: Cambodia Is Moving The Right Way: Three Takeaways - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: A visit to Cambodia can give you the sense of existing in several centuries at once.

data.title: Cambodia Has Not Tilted Away from China - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cambodia’s perceived tilt towards the West has not come at the expense of its relations with Beijing. The country has maintained its diversified foreign policy position.

data.title: Caught between giants: Why Cambodia looks to Australia - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: With Phnom Penh aiming to diversify its strategic options, Canberra seems like a good bet.

data.title: Does China now have a permanent military base in Cambodia? - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: China is expanding its military footprint, beyond the three disputed islands in the South China Sea which it has already seized and fortified.

data.title: Cambodia says China to hand over two warships - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cambodia said on Thursday that China will soon hand over two warships to improve its defence capabilities, despite United States fears about Beijing boosting its military influence in the strategic Gulf of Thailand.

data.title: Cambodia Pulls Out of Economic Agreement With Vietnam and Laos - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Phnom Penh’s withdrawal from the CLV Triangle Development Area pact marks a potentially important shift in Cambodia-Vietnam relations.

data.title: Cambodian opposition figure in court on incitement charge - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: An outspoken Cambodian opposition politician appeared in court Friday for questioning on new charges, the latest in a series of legal cases brought by the authorities against dissenting voices.

data.title: PH to Cambodia: Filipinas in surrogacy scheme are victims, not criminals - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: The Philippine Embassy is appealing to the Cambodian government not to file criminal charges against the 20 Filipinas rescued from alleged surrogacy schemes.

data.title: The son almost rises: Cambodia's Hun Sen the power behind throne - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cambodian Prime Minister Hun Manet kept a low profile at the ASEAN summit in Vientiane.

data.title: Revived Cambodian Nationalism Threatens to Undermine ‘Special’ Relationship With Vietnam - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Anti-Vietnamese resentment has spelled an end to a cross-border cooperation agreement with Vietnam and Laos.

data.title: Southeast Asia’s war on dissent captured in Malaysia-Cambodia extradition - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: As Southeast Asian countries band together to silence critics, advocates call for an urgent reassessment of human rights policies.

data.title: Japan’s sensitive approach to cooperation with Cambodia - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Japanese academic Shin Kawashima notes that Japan-Cambodia relations have grown in the past few decades, but there is still a way to go before Japan can match the US and China in contributing resources and assistance to Cambodia in areas such as security and economy.

data.title: Can Hun Manet chart Cambodia a new course free from his father’s shadow? - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: The new PM’s first year in charge has been defined by attempts to bolster Cambodia’s international standing and prioritise strong China ties.

data.title: Experts warn of regional impact and US concerns over Chinese warships - The Cambodia Daily
data.description: Cambodia's increasing military ties with China, including the recent docking of Chinese warships, have sparked concerns about US influence in the region, the stability of the South China Sea, and Cambodia's neutrality within ASEAN.
